details: Is more irritating than others of this botanical family, as seen in the skin symptoms. BORING, GNAWING PAIN very marked. PEMPHIGUS. Periodical complaints. Fainting with pain in stomach.

Head: Frightful dreams about corpses, serpents, battles, etc. fluent coryza, with sneezing and burning micturition
Gnawing in one spot left of vertex
Abdomen: Sensation of a plug behind umbilicus
Pain over region of liver, with sensation as if diarrhoea would set in
Pressure as of a plug behind right false ribs; worse, deep inspiration
Chest: Bruised pain and weakness in the chest every evening
Skin: Acrid exudation, which makes surrounding parts sore
Vesicular eruption, with tendency to form large blisters
Extremities: Sudden burning sticking in right toe
Corns, with burning and soreness, especially when feet hang down

name: Ranunculus sceleratus
